018
019package org.tquadrat.foundation.util;
020
021import static java.util.Collections.reverse;
022import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.STABLE;
023import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.nonNull;
024import static org.tquadrat.foundation.lang.Objects.requireNonNullArgument;
025
026import java.util.ArrayList;
027import java.util.Collection;
028import java.util.Iterator;
029import java.util.Optional;
030import java.util.function.Consumer;
031import java.util.function.IntFunction;
032import java.util.stream.Stream;
033
034import org.apiguardian.api.API;
035import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
036import org.tquadrat.foundation.util.internal.HeadTailListImpl;
037
038/**
039 *  <p>{@summary A {@code HeadTailList} is an unmodifiable list data
040 *  structure}.</p>
041 *  <p>Each modifying operation on it will create a new instance <i>of the
042 *  list</i>, leaving the original list one unchanged.</p>
043 *  <p>But only the list itself is copied, not the entries in it – these are
044 *  shared amongst all copies of the list. Consequently changes to the data
045 *  stored in the list should be avoided.</p>
046 *  <p>To create a new instance of {@code HeadTailList}, call one of</p>
047 *  <ul>
048 *      <li>{@link #empty()} for an empty list</li>
049 *      <li>{@link #from(Object[])} to initialise the list with some
050 *          elements</li>
051 *      <li>{@link #from(Collection)} to initialise the new list from a
052 *          {@link Collection}</li>
053 *  </ul>
054 *
055 *  @param  <T> The element type of the list.
056 *
057 *  @extauthor Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
058 *  @version $Id: HeadTailList.java 995 2022-01-23 01:09:35Z tquadrat $
059 *  @since 0.0.4
060 *
061 *  @UMLGraph.link
062 */
063@SuppressWarnings( "ClassWithTooManyMethods" )
064@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: HeadTailList.java 995 2022-01-23 01:09:35Z tquadrat $" )
065@API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.4" )
066public sealed interface HeadTailList<T> extends Iterable<T>
067    permits HeadTailListImpl
068{
069        /*---------*\
070    ====** Methods **==========================================================
071        \*---------*/
072    /**
073     *  Returns a new list with the given element as the head, and this list as
074     *  the tail.
075     *
076     *  @param  element The head for the new list.
077     *  @return The new list.
078     */
079    public HeadTailList<T> add( final T element );
080
081    /**
082     *  Returns a new list where the given list is appended to the end of this
083     *  list.
084     *
085     *  @param  list    The list to append.
086     *  @return The new list.
087     */
088    public default HeadTailList<T> append( final HeadTailList<T> list )
089    {
090        final var retValue = requireNonNullArgument( list, "list" ).prepend( this );
091
092        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
093        return retValue;
094    }   //  append()
095
096    /**
097     *  Returns a new list where the given list is appended to the end of this
098     *  list.
099     *
100     *  @param  list    The list to append.
101     *  @return The new list.
102     */
103    public default HeadTailList<T> append( final Collection<T> list )
104    {
105        final var retValue = from( requireNonNullArgument( list, "list" ) ).prepend( this );
106
107        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
108        return retValue;
109    }   //  append()
110
111    /**
112     *  Checks whether the list contains an element that is equal to the given
113     *  one.
114     *
115     *  @param  element The element to look for.
116     *  @return {@code true} if the element is in the list, {@code false}
117     *      otherwise.
118     */
119    public default boolean contains( final T element )
120    {
121        var retValue = false;
122        if( nonNull( element ) )
123        {
124            //noinspection ForLoopWithMissingComponent
125            for( final var i = iterator(); i.hasNext() && !retValue; ) retValue = i.next().equals( element );
126        }
127
128        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
129        return retValue;
130    }   //  contains()
131
132    /**
133     *  <p>{@summary Returns an empty list.}</p>
134     *  <p>Each call to this method will return the same instance.</p>
135     *
136     *  @param  <E> The element type for the list.
137     *  @return The empty list.
138     */
139    public static <E> HeadTailList<E> empty() { return HeadTailListImpl.empty(); }
140
141    /**
142     *  {@inheritDoc}
143     */
144    @Override
145    public boolean equals( Object o );
146
147    /**
148     *  Does the same as
149     *  {@link #forEach(Consumer)}, but starting with last element first.
150     *
151     *  @param  action  The action to perform.
152     */
153    public void forEachReverse( final Consumer<? super T> action );
154
155    /**
156     *  Creates a new list from the given
157     *  {@link Collection}.
158     *
159     *  @param  <E> The element type for the list.
160     *  @param  source  The collection.
161     *  @return The new list.
162     */
163    public static <E> HeadTailList<E> from( final Collection<E> source )
164    {
165        HeadTailList<E> retValue = empty();
166        if( !requireNonNullArgument( source, "source" ).isEmpty() )
167        {
168            final var list = new ArrayList<>( source );
169            reverse( list );
170            for( final var e : list ) retValue = retValue.add( e );
171        }
172
173        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
174        return retValue;
175    }   //  from()
176
177    /**
178     *  Creates a new list from the given elements.
179     *
180     *  @param  <E> The element type for the list.
181     *  @param  elements    The elements.
182     *  @return The new list.
183     */
184    public static <E> HeadTailList<E> from( final E... elements )
185    {
186        HeadTailList<E> retValue = empty();
187        for( var i = requireNonNullArgument( elements, "elements" ).length; i > 0; --i )
188        {
189            retValue = retValue.add( elements [i - 1] );
190        }
191
192        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
193        return retValue;
194    }   //  from()
195
196    /**
197     *  <p>{@summary Returns the element that is identified by the given
198     *  index}</p>
199     *  <p>The index is in reverse order of the insertion sequence; this means
200     *  tha the element added first has the highest index value
201     *  (<code>size()&nbsp;-&nbsp;1</code>).</p>
202     *
203     *  @param  index   The index for the wanted element; 0 indicates the head.
204     *  @return The element with the given index.
205     *  @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException   The given index is out of the range
206     *      <code>index&nbsp;&lt;&nbsp;0&nbsp;||&nbsp;index&nbsp;&gt;=&nbsp;size()</code>.
207     */
208    public default T get( final int index ) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
209    {
210        if( head().isEmpty() || (index < 0) ) throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException( Integer.toString( index ) );
211        final var retValue = index == 0 ? head().get() : tail().get( index - 1 );
212
213        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
214        return retValue;
215    }   //  get()
216
217    /**
218     *  {@inheritDoc}
219     */
220    @Override
221    public int hashCode();
222
223    /**
224     *  <p>{@summary Returns the head of the list.}</p>
225     *  <p>This will be
226     *  {@linkplain Optional#empty() empty}
227     *  only for the
228     *  {@linkplain #empty() empty list}.</p>
229     *
230     *  @return An instance of
231     *      {@link Optional}
232     *      that holds the head.
233     */
234    public Optional<T> head();
235
236    /**
237     *  Checks whether the list is empty.
238     *
239     *  @return {@code true} if the list is empty, {@code false} otherwise.
240     */
241    public boolean isEmpty();
242
243    /**
244     *  {@inheritDoc}
245     */
246    @SuppressWarnings( "AbstractMethodOverridesAbstractMethod" )
247    @Override
248    public Iterator<T> iterator();
249
250    /**
251     *  <p>{@summary Returns a new list where the given list is merged into
252     *  this list.}</p>
253     *  <p>This means that each element from this list is followed by an
254     *  element of the other list; if one list is shorter than the other one,
255     *  the elements of the longer one will just be appended to the end of the
256     *  new list.</p>
257     *
258     *  @param  list    The list to merge into this one.
259     *  @return The new list.
260     */
261    public default HeadTailList<T> merge( final HeadTailList<? extends T> list )
262    {
263        @SuppressWarnings( "unchecked" )
264        var retValue = (HeadTailList<T>) empty();
265        final var j = requireNonNullArgument( list, "list" ).revert().iterator();
266        final var i = revert().iterator();
267        while( i.hasNext() && j.hasNext() )
268        {
269            retValue = retValue.add( i.next() ).add( j.next() );
270        }
271        while( i.hasNext() ) retValue = retValue.add( i.next() );
272        while( j.hasNext() ) retValue = retValue.add( j.next() );
273
274        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
275        return retValue;
276    }   //  merge()
277
278    /**
279     *  Returns a new list where this list is appended to the end of the given
280     *  list.
281     *
282     *  @param  list    The list to prepend.
283     *  @return The new list.
284     */
285    public default HeadTailList<T> prepend( final HeadTailList<T> list )
286    {
287        final var arg = requireNonNullArgument( list, "list" );
288        var retValue = this;
289        for( final var e : arg.revert() ) retValue = retValue.add( e );
290
291        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
292        return retValue;
293    }   //  prepend()
294
295    /**
296     *  Returns a new list where the entries of the given list are placed
297     *  before the first entry of this list.
298     *
299     *  @param  list    The list to prepend.
300     *  @return The new list.
301     */
302    public default HeadTailList<T> prepend( final Collection<T> list )
303    {
304        var retValue = this;
305        if( !requireNonNullArgument( list, "list" ).isEmpty() )
306        {
307            final var l = new ArrayList<>( list );
308            reverse( l );
309            for( final var e : l ) retValue = retValue.add( e );
310        }
311
312        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
313        return retValue;
314    }   //  prepend()
315
316    /**
317     *  Returns a copy of this list that does not contain the given element.
318     *
319     *  @param  element The element to be removed.
320     *  @return The copy of the list.
321     */
322    public default HeadTailList<T> remove( final T element )
323    {
324        var retValue = this;
325        if( nonNull( element ) )
326        {
327            retValue = empty();
328            for( final var e : revert() )
329            {
330                if( !e.equals( element ) ) retValue = retValue.add( e );
331            }
332        }
333
334        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
335        return retValue;
336    }   //  remove()
337
338    /**
339     *  Returns a new copy of this list where the head element is replaced by
340     *  the given element.
341     *
342     *  @param  newHead The element that is the new head for the list.
343     *  @return The copy with the new head.
344     */
345    public default HeadTailList<T> replaceHead( final T newHead )
346    {
347        final var retValue = tail().add( requireNonNullArgument( newHead, "newHead" ) );
348
349        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
350        return retValue;
351    }   //  replaceHead()
352
353    /**
354     *  Revert the list; that means that the sequence of the elements in the
355     *  new list is in reverse order that in this one.
356     *
357     *  @return The new list with the reverted order of the elements.
358     */
359    public default HeadTailList<T> revert()
360    {
361        @SuppressWarnings( "unchecked" )
362        var retValue = (HeadTailList<T>) empty();
363        for( final var e : this ) retValue = retValue.add( e );
364
365        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
366        return retValue;
367    }   //  revert()
368
369    /**
370     *  Returns the size of the list.
371     *
372     *  @return The size of the list.
373     */
374    public int size();
375
376    /**
377     *  Returns a
378     *  {@link Stream}
379     *  that is backed by this list.
380     *
381     *  @return The stream.
382     */
383    public Stream<T> stream();
384
385    /**
386     *  Returns the tail of the list.
387     *
388     *  @return The tail list.
389     */
390    public HeadTailList<T> tail();
391
392    /**
393     *  Returns the contents of this list as an array.
394     *
395     *  @return The array.
396     */
397    public Object [] toArray();
398
399    /**
400     *  <p>{@summary Returns the contents of this list in the provided
401     *  array.}</p>
402     *  <p>If the provided array is larger that the number of elements on the
403     *  stack, the exceeding entries on that array remained unchanged.</p>
404     *
405     *  @param  target  The target array; if this array has an insufficient
406     *      size, a new array will be created.
407     *  @return An array with all entries from the list; never {@code null}. If
408     *      the provided array was large enough to take all elements, it will
409     *      be returned, otherwise the returned array is a new one and the
410     *      provided array is unchanged.
411     */
412    @SuppressWarnings( "MethodCanBeVariableArityMethod" )
413    public T [] toArray( final T [] target );
414
415    /**
416     *  <p>{@summary Returns the contents of this list in  array that is
417     *  provided by the given supplier.}</p>
418     *  <p>If the provided array is larger that the number of elements on the
419     *  stack, the exceeding entries on that array remained unchanged.</p>
420     *  <p>If the array is too small, a new array will be created.</p>
421     *
422     *  @param  supplier    The supplier for the target array.
423     *  @return An array with all entries on the stack; never {@code null}. If
424     *      the provided array was large enough to take all elements, it will
425     *      be returned, otherwise the returned array is a new one and the
426     *      provided array is unchanged.
427     */
428    public default T [] toArray( final IntFunction<T []> supplier )
429    {
430        return toArray( supplier.apply( size() ) );
431    }   //  toArray()
432}
433//  interface HeadTailList
434
435/*
436 *  End of File
437 */
